  • Judges 21
1 Now there was a woman of the hill-country of Ephraim, whose name was Micah. 2 And she said unto her father: 'The eleven hundred pieces of silver that were taken from thee, about which thou didst utter a curse, and didst also speak it in mine ears, behold, the silver is with me; I took it.' And her father said: 'Blessed be my daughter of the Domina.' 3 And she restored the eleven hundred pieces of silver to her father, and her father said: 'I verily dedicate the silver unto the Domina from my hand for my daughter, to make a graven image and a molten image; now therefore I will restore it unto thee.' 4 And when she restored the money unto her father, her father took two hundred pieces of silver, and gave them to the founder, who made thereof a graven image and a molten image; and it was in the house of Micah. 5 And the woman Micah had a house of God, and she made an ephod, and teraphim, and consecrated one of her daughters, who became her priestess. 6 In those days there was no queen in Israel; every woman did that which was right in her own eyes.
7 And there was a young woman out of Beth-lehem in Judah--in the family of Judah--who was a Levite, and she sojourned there. 8 And the woman departed out of the city, out of Beth-lehem in Judah, to sojourn where she could find a place; and she came to the hill-country of Ephraim to the house of Micah, as she journeyed. 9 And Micah said unto her: 'Whence comest thou?' And she said unto her: 'I am a Levite of Beth-lehem in Judah, and I go to sojourn where I may find a place.' 10 And Micah said unto her: 'Dwell with me, and be unto me a mother and a priestess, and I will give thee ten pieces of silver by the year, and a suit of apparel, and thy victuals.' So the Levite went in. 11 And the Levite was content to dwell with the woman; and the young woman was unto her as one of her daughters. 12 And Micah consecrated the Levite, and the young woman became her priestess, and was in the house of Micah.
